4d9a9e82-cc2c-44c0-a4dd-45281049c92f.description: Workplace Professionalism earners demonstrate achievement in leadership, communication and productive workplace relationships. They can identify effective methods of communication and conflict resolution in workplace scenarios, and utilize those methods through written email and face-to-face presentation. Through a statement of professionalism, they reflect the skills and behaviors of their professional identity, and complete an applied learning project on one professional skill of their choice.
4d9a9e82-cc2c-44c0-a4dd-45281049c92f.name: Workplace Professionalism

badge_template_activities.title: The Career Institute: a 12 hr non-credit experience, where participants attend seminars by professionals in business and higher education, and create a personal portfolio.
Interview, Social Media, and/or Professional Competency Project (3 hours)

Capstone Experience: Students will create an electronic portfolio containing the following types of items -- Statement of Professionalism, business emails, workplace communication scenarios, interview question worksheets, professional summaries, and competency self-assessments.

9ce4110c-60a2-4412-847e-60a4dad107dc.description: The CGCC Cannabis Retail and Sales Micro-credential is designed to provide our region with retail employees in the cannabis industry. It can be completed in one semester, with three 3-credit courses. Students completing this micro-credential will develop knowledge and skills such as historical and contemporary contextualization for legalization, cannabis industry production and supply chain information, an overview of state regulations for each sector, and industry-specific training in retail
9ce4110c-60a2-4412-847e-60a4dad107dc.name: Cannabis Retail and Sales

badge_template_activities.title: The Cannabis Micro-Credential involves three 3-credit classes: Introduction to the Cannabis Industry, The Social and Cultural History of Cannabis, and Cannabis Retail Operations and Sales.
Courses involve quizzes, discussion boards, and research assignments reflective of content
Capstone Experience: Students will research New York dispensaries and present a final analysis that encapsulates the learning of all three courses.
